version_description:
We have included the ability to hide the side bar on iPad and iPhone 6 plus.  Thanks for reviews from SvetP, Wertyihvsbcgnnkjgdaa, TM1971, missflick18 and J who requested this change.

What's next?
New features for iOS9, the ability to read and respond to comments.

Also a great many reviewers are frustrated with crashes.  This remains a high priority to address and we are working incrementally to reduce crashes and improve reading experience.

Also a great many reviewers are frustrated with crashes.  This remains a high priority to address and we are working incrementally to reduce crashes and improve reading experience.

Also a great many reviewers are frustrated with crashes.  This remains a high priority to address and we are working incrementally to reduce crashes and improve reading experience.

Includes fixes for the following issues:  
* users who cannot upgrade to the newest version (incl. legacy devices such as iPhone 5 and early-model iPads)
* devices on iOS 8 experiencing crashes
Thank you to our users who reported these issues over the holidays. We greatly appreciate your patience and hope you enjoy the latest update.

Captions are now displaying on all images as intended. Thanks for your patience on this one, we know it was annoying. We also fixed a bug that prevented photo galleries from launching properly.

Some users had their regional push alerts settings reset. We found the culprit and this should be fixed. Please check your push alerts settings to make sure you don't miss anything!

On April 4th, Saskatchewan goes to the polls for their provincial election.  Election results will be provided live in app with this release.

The new CBC News app delivers news and analysis of the stories that matter most to Canadians. Be the first to know with our breaking news alerts. Customize your lineups with local and national stories from our trusted reporters across Canada and around the globe. 

Features:
-Read up-to-the-minute national, international and local news.
-Customize your lineups with headlines from any of our newsrooms across the country.
-Subscribe to the breaking news alerts in your region. 
-Find the stories you’re seeking with our powerful new search.
-Watch video from CBC News, including The National.
-Save stories for reading later, with or without a connection.

We’re thrilled to share our app with you and hope you’ll enjoy it as much as our ever-growing community does.

If you’d like to report an issue or request a feature, please contact us at https://cbchelp.cbc.ca/hc/en-us

- Accessibility support added to Settings menu.
- Fixed issues when changing device orientation
- Performance improvements

Note: Some iPad 4 users may still experience rotation problems. We are continuing to work on a fix.

If you’d like to report an issue or request a feature, please go to Settings -> Send us your feedback, or contact us at https://cbchelp.cbc.ca/hc/en-us.

Attn: There is a bug in this build affecting 32-bit devices. This includes iPhone 5C, iPhone 5, iPhone 4S, iPad 4, iPad Mini, iPad 3, iPad 2 and iPod touch 5th-gen. Hold off on updating until we have a fix in place.

Our Local section now allows you to sort stories by Editor's picks or Publishing time. We’ve made a fix so we can remember where you were in the lineup when you return to it after reading a story. And we're happy to say the keyboard now neatly disappears as you scroll through your search results. As always, we continue to polish and refine our design. 

Have a feature to request or an issue to report? We'd love to hear from you. Contact us via the app by visiting Settings > Send us your feedback

We've made performance improvements.
We've fixed a few bugs and have made some improvements.
We’ve fixed a few bugs in this release and Chromecast is now supported for videos.

Our story pages now load faster and have been rebuilt to address earlier formatting problems, like overlapping images. You'll also now be able to resize text through your system settings. We've made accessibility improvements to better support voiceover. And finally, in the Today view of your Notification Centre, we've added a square image which allows more headline text to be visible at a glance.

Previously, the app crashed for some iOS 9 and 10 users when they launched the election section. We've fixed this bug. Also, some users may have opened links to stories unexpectedly when scrolling -- this has also been fixed. We've also made other performance improvements.
